author: Reuters Editorial
title: CORRECTED-Egypt's annual urban consumer price inflation decreases to 13.1 pct in April from 13.3 pct in March -CAPMAS
text:
(Changes to “annual urban consumer price” from “core” in headline)
CAIRO, May 10 (Reuters) - Egypt’s annual urban consumer price inflation decreased to 13.1 percent in April from 13.3 percent in March, the official statistics agency CAPMAS said on Thursday.
Inflation jumped after Egypt devalued its currency in November 2016. It reached a record high in July on the back of energy subsidy cuts but has gradually eased since then. (Reporting by Hesham Hajali, editing by Larry King)
